jobs.description:
Hey üëã

Since we launched over 3 years ago, we‚Äôve been on a mission üëä A mission to make everyone (starting with our awesome Plumsters), financially better off!

We do this by helping automate their savings, avoid overpaying on bills, and providing a simple platform to invest, if they‚Äôd like to try and grow their money for the future üå±

Plum is a quirky and fun AI assistant that started life as a Messenger chatbot (now also available as an app for Android and iOS). By linking directly to our users‚Äô bank accounts, we are able to analyse transaction data to learn about their income and spending.

We use this to make sure savings still happen even when they‚Äôre not thinking about it, because we believe this helps them save‚Ä¶ MORE! We can also scan tariffs to advise when we think they‚Äôre paying too much on bills e.g. household utilities üîå

Plum is also a business, and every business ultimately needs to make money. But the social aspect of what we do is also really important to us. We‚Äôre trying to change things for the better, by helping our users fight against a confusing financial system that is stacked against the most vulnerable in society (such as those on low income or the elderly).

Specifically, here‚Äôs what we‚Äôre trying to tackle:

- 90% of UK savings accounts pay less than inflation
- ¬£4bn lost to the loyalty penalty every year
- ‚Öî of UK adults say money stress has affected the health or wellbeing of someone they know

Since the beginning of 2017, we've grown from 2 founders sharing a rusty desk in Soho, to a brilliant, hard-working team of 40, and raised $10.5 million in total.

Now, with more than 850,000 people already using Plum, we could use a little help with our mission‚Ä¶ and that may be where you come in!

We‚Äôre looking for a talented Backend Engineer to join our Athens team.

**Engineering at Plum**

Our engineers come from a variety of backgrounds (physics, computer science, music, even history!) and we welcome all levels of experience. We value good engineering principles and healthy curiosity. We take a conservative approach to using external frameworks and we aspire to write simple, well-tested code, delivered in rapid iterations.

We currently operate a Python monolith on a 80+ pod Kubernetes cluster on Google Cloud Platform and wrangle ~1TB of data in Postgres and BigQuery. You'll get to work on bank data ingestion, payments, investments, data pipelines, user-facing features and our in-house chat framework (think NLP). On top, you'll play an integral role in taking Plum's infrastructure to an exciting next level ‚Äì a suite of fault-tolerant, self-contained backend services. It's a really good chance to get your hands dirty with a product that is already used by 850,000 people in the UK.

**How we work**

We work in "[squads](https://labs.spotify.com/2014/03/27/spotify-engineering-culture-part-1/)" ‚Äì a more startup-appropriate name for saying small, cross-functional teams. Each squad has a mission and a set of KPIs to monitor and improve. We have 3 of these squads right now ‚Äì Savings, Investments and Black Ops. As an engineer you'll work in a squad but you can also reach out to and work with anyone in the company.

Our culture: openness and accountability

Even though you'll have a primary role, you can get involved in any aspect of the business you're interested in and contribute feedback and product ideas freely. In return, we'll expect you to back your decisions with data and logic. Features are considered finished when the data tells us that they've moved the needle.

**What we look for**

Technical knowledge is critical but we are a startup treading in uncharted territory so attitude is even more important. We're looking for people that like uncertainty and want to figure out how to do things that haven‚Äôt been done before. You're a true team player and inherently positive. Where others see problems, you see solutions.

**What we offer**

- Join one of the hottest fintech start-up in London üá¨üáß
- One of the best learning experiences of your life. You'll get to work with extremely smart and capable people, with backgrounds in finance, physics, history, computing, languages and more.
- We're all in this together! Own part of the company through stock options üí∑
- Our annual team trip, to a secret destination ‚úàÔ∏è
- We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity
- Flexibility to work from our London office (almost) whenever you want
- 22 days holiday a year, excluding bank holidays (35 in total)
- An office brimming with fruit & snacks, coffee, plants, and a vibe that‚Äôs... ü¶ÑüåàüíØ

If you think this sounds like a bit of you then don‚Äôt hesitate to get in touch!

Thanks,

Plum‚Äôs tame humans üíú

jobs.title: Head of Finance & Operations
jobs.description:
At Plum, we're on a mission to help everyone be financially better off. We're building an intelligent financial assistant that links to your bank, understands your spending habits and helps you save more, invest in things that matter and avoid overspending on your bills. We like to think of Plum as your money's best friend üë´

We're VC-backed, having raised ~$10m to date, 650k+ users and a team of 30 passionate people with offices in London and Athens. We are looking for our finance director who will be part of the journey as we scale further, grow to 100+ employees, launch across Europe while scaling the revenue and spend in our journey to make people financially better off.

### Your Mission:

- Think strategically about how we can get the business to the next level from both a financing and also business revenue focus perspective.
- Live and breathe on Unit economic, Payback, CPA and various segment value. Be able to engage with the organisation productively on this. 
- Be able to tell the story of Plum via both growth and financial metrics how that ties back to LTV.
- Be an effective communicator of future strategy of Plum.
- Focus on how to maintain and accelerate growth in a sustainable manner.
- Be the ultimate owner of Plum's strategic partners both on the operational and revenue side.

We value good engineering principles, imagination, quirkiness and healthy curiosity. We take a conservative approach to using external frameworks and we aspire to write simple, well-tested code, delivered in rapid iterations.

**How we work**

We work in "[squads](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Flabs.spotify.com%2F2014%2F03%2F27%2Fspotify-engineering-culture-part-1%2F)" ‚Äì a more startup-appropriate name for saying small, cross-functional teams. As an engineer you'll work in a squad but you can also reach out to and work with anyone in the company.

**Our culture: openness and accountability**

Even though you'll have a primary role, you can get involved in any aspect of the business you're interested in and contribute feedback and product ideas freely.
